para.sentence: For other values of z , \Phi\left(z,s,a\right) is defined by analytic continuation.
This is the notation used in Erdélyi et al. (1953a, p. 27).Lerch (1887) used \mathfrak{K}(a,x,s)=\Phi\left(e^{2\pi ix},s,a\right).

The Hurwitz zeta function \zeta\left(s,a\right) (§25.11) and the polylogarithm \mathrm{Li}_{s}\left(z\right) (§25.12(ii)) are special cases: \zeta\left(s,a\right)=\Phi\left(1,s,a\right), if \Re s>1, a\neq 0,-1,-2,\dots, \mathrm{Li}_{s}\left(z\right)=z\Phi\left(z,s,1\right), if \Re s>1, |z|\leq 1.
With the conditions of (25.14.1) and m=1,2,3,\dots , \Phi\left(z,s,a\right)=z^{m}\Phi\left(z,s,a+m\right)+\sum_{n=0}^{m-1}\frac{z^{ n}}{(a+n)^{s}}.

\Phi\left(z,s,a\right)=\frac{1}{2}a^{-s}+\int_{0}^{\infty}\frac{z^{x}}{(a+x)^{ s}}\mathrm{d}x-2\int_{0}^{\infty}\frac{\sin\left(x\ln z-s\operatorname{arctan} \left(x/a\right)\right)}{(a^{2}+x^{2})^{s/2}(e^{2\pi x}-1)}\mathrm{d}x, if \Re s>0 if |z|<1; \Re s>1 if |z|=1,\Re a>0.
For these and further properties see Erdélyi et al. (1953a, pp. 27–31).
